node.text: Hello manager. Welcome to Lobotomy Corporation. Starting today you are responsible for managing the abnormalities we have and ensuring that we meet the daily energy quota.
You can move the camera around with the W, A, S, and D keys on your keyboard. You can also press and hold the secondary mouse button (RMB) and drag the mouse.
You can zoom the screen in and out with the F and G keys on your keyboard. The scroll wheel on the mouse can also be used.

Let's try a simple maneuver. When you hover your mouse over an employee, some information about them will be show on the top right corner. Please try selecting an employee by pressing the primary mouse button (LMB).

Well done. The information displayed in the panel on the right is related to the selected employee. Some of this information is important, such as their state and E.G.O equipment. Please look article in the manual titled <Employees> for more details about what the information means.
The bar at the top left of the screen displays the amount of energy you need to collect to end the day. The top right corner lists what missions you are able to clear today.

Energy is produced when a product called Positive Enkephalin (PE, a green box) is released by an abnormality. This can occur while it is being worked on. Please click on the containment unit that holds an abnormality with the primary mouse button (LMB).

Since you have yet to learn (unlock) any information about this abnormality, you have no way of knowing how it will respond to the 4 different works. In order to learn this information, an employee has to perform a work with it. For now, please select the first type of work availible, Instinct work.

Instinct work satisfies an abnormality's primal and physiological desires. When an employee conducts Instinct work, their Fortitude will increase at the end of the day. Increasing Fortitude raises their Health Points (HP).

Every work you can request your employees to perform on abnormalities will have different results. These results differ for each abnormality. The success rate for type of work also varies per abnormality.

A fragile mind can be quite strained when meeting an abnormality. If your employee is not mentally ready, it may make the abnormality seem more frightening or disturbing to them. As such, they may have a serious reaction encountering it, which will lower their Sanity Points (SP).

Abnormalities release Enkephalin when employees work with them. We collect this into boxes. Depending on how the employee performs the work, the abnormality will respond either Positively or Negatively. When it reacts positively, it will release Positive Enkephalin, which produces a green PE-Box.

However, if the abnormality reacts negatively, it will release Negative Enkephalin instead, and damage the employee. Please keep in mind that when an employee's Health or Sanity drops completely, the work is forcefully ended.

An abnormality's mood might change depending on the outcome of the work done with it. This outcome can be predicted based on the amount of PE-Boxes we obtained thanks to the work. An abnormality has generally three ways of responding: Good, Neutral and Bad. Depending on the outcome, it may use a special ability or try to escape.

When the work is finished, the energy and PE-Boxes that were generated are collected. PE-Boxes are stored and shown in the abnormality's PE-Box counter. Each abnormality produces a set of PE-Boxes unique to them. These can be used to unlock more of an abnormality's information which in turn increases the observation level, or to extract E.G.O Equipment from it.

After a work has been performed with an abnormality, you cannot work again with it for a short period of time. Until you can work with it again, you can send your employees to work with other abnormalities or let them heal up.
When the regenerator gauge fills up completely, employees in the main room will be healed. This will restore both their Health (HP) and Sanity (SP).
Let's try ordering an employee to go work using a different method. First, click on the employee using the primary mouse button (LMB).
Now use the secondary mouse button (RMB) to click on the abnormality containment unit. (Please be aware you can accidentally deselect the employee)
We still don't know much about this abnormality, so order the employee to perform Insight work with it.

Insight work is conducted to improve the environment in which the abnormality resides. When an employee conducts Insight work, their Prudence will increase at the end of the day. Increasing Prudence raises their Sanity Points (SP).

You seem to have collected enough of this abnormality's PE-Boxes. It's time to learn about observation. Please press the label bar (nameplate) displayed at the top of the containment unit. At the moment it displays the subject number instead of the name. After unlocking the abnormality's basic information, the name will be displayed here instead.
This displays the information we currently have on the abnormality. As you can see, we have little knowledge about it, as most of it is locked away.
You need to spend some of the unique PE-Boxes we collected from the abnormality in order to gain specific information. Please try to unlock the basic information about the abnormality.

Details concerning the management process of the abnormality are displayed here. If there is something the abnormality doesn't like, it can result in a decrease of its Qliphoth Counter and cause problems in energy production, so make sure you unlock and read these thoroughly. Please try to unlock it now.

How the abnormality's would react towards the different types of work is displayed here. The more prefered the work is, the higher the succesrate will be. The number on the left of it indicates the level of the work an employee has to have with it for the displayed succesrate to count. Please unlock all the work favor guidelines.

Let's proceed. This area here shows what maximum Qliphoth Counter value of the abnormality is. It will also show whether or not the abnormality will escape when the Qliphoth Counter reached 0 as well as how resistant it is to certain types of damage after it has escaped, which is something you would need to know to manage such situation. Please unlock the escape information.

You are now finished with the observation of this abnormality. As you unlock information details, the observation level of the abnormality is increased and will give benefits when working with the abnormality, such as an increased work speed or succesrate.

As you increase the observation level and reach a certain point, you will be capable of extracting E.G.O Equipment from the abnormality at the cost of PE-Boxes. E.G.O Weapons are powerful tools that can help with suppressing abnormalities. Please extract an E.G.O Weapon.

An E.G.O Suit offers an increased resistance to certain types of damage. Some types of damage might come in harder than others depending on what E.G.O Suit the employee uses. Please extract an E.G.O Suit.

Well done. You can see what E.G.O Gift the abnormality has a chance on passing to an employee here. If this area is unlocked, when an employee finishes work with the abnormality, they would have a chance of receiving the E.G.O Gift displayed here. Usually the chances of this happening are slim.
Now lastly, let's check the abnormality's observation records. Please click on Abnormality Story.

You can see the obversation records of the abnormality here. Entries are be added as your observation level increases. Looks like we reviewed everything, so let's close this information window. Please press Leave.

Now that you have unlocked the basic information, some of this information is displayed on top of the containment unit. And since we unlocked the work favors, we now know the abnormality prefers attachment work. Let's try ordering an employee to perform attachment work on it. Click on the abnormality's containment unit.
Some of the basic information is displayed in this window as well, which might be useful. Please try ordering an employee to do attachment work.

Since you unlocked the favor guide for attachment work, the succesrate the employee has and amount of time they need to perform the work is displayed. You can also see the information details of the employee when you hover your mouse over them. This allows you to make mindful decisions when giving the work orders. Please select an employee to do the work.
Let me warn you about one more thing. When your employees enter a containment unit to do work with an abnormality, the Qliphoth Meltdown guage is filled up by one block.

When the guage is filled up completely, a Qliphoth Meltdown will occur in the facility. The number next to the guage shows how many containment units will be affected. The affected units themselves will have a Meltdown Alert displayed around them.

When the Qliphoth Meltdown happens, the containment unit has beside the alert indication a timer displayed with a bar on top of it. Normally this would slowly drop, but when the abnormality inside the containment unit is being worked on at that time, the meltdown timer is put on hold till after it is finished.

The meltdown can be taken care of by performing work with the abnormality of the affected containment unit. If the meltdown is not dismissed within the time limit, energy will be lost and the Qliphoth Counter of the unit will drop to 0, so please try to prevent that. You can see more detailed information about this in the manual at the <Repeated Work Penalty> article.

Whenever a Qliphoth meltdown occurs in the facility, the Meltdown Level increases. The higher the meltdown level is, the more containment units that will be affected by the Qliphoth Meltdown. There is also a chance of Ordeals appearing instead of a meltdown happening. If you wish to know what Ordeals are, please consult the manual and look at the relevant article.

I think I told you almost everything about managing abnormalities. If you wish to read more about it, please look it up in the manual. You can consult it at any time during management by pressing F1. Now finish the management of this day by pressing the Complete button at the top.

After finishing management of the day, the employees who performed work will have their state values increased according to the types of work they performed. After a state value passes a certain point, it's level will increase. The level of the employee can also increase after having enough total value points. The employees that achieved this are considered promoted and shown in the list below.

You will also receive LOB as a reward for your work according to your management rank. You can increase your management rank by letting more employees survive the day. The higher your management rank, the more LOB you receive. If however there is an abnormality on the loose when you finish the management of the day, you will lose some of the LOB you were about to earn.
You can see which missions you succesfully managed to complete on this day in the list here. When you succesfully complete a mission, you can conduct research at the start of the next day.

After finishing management, you can choose to go to the next day or retry this day. Dead employees and destroyed E.G.O Equipment are recovered when you choose retry, but you will lose observations, PE-Boxes, extracted E.G.O Equipment and the promotions employees received for their work on this day.
Now please press Skip to Next Day. I will tell you about deployment next.

When you succesfully manage to clear a mission on the previous day, you can conduct research. Proposals for research are then displayed at the start of the day. You can select one and conduct the research by clicking and dragging it to the slot in the lower right, then hitting OK. Please try to do so with this example research purposal.

Do you recall how much LOB you received during management the other day? You can see the total amount of LOB you have left over here. During this tutorial phase, I will show you how you can spend your LOB, how you can hire new employees and how you can set them up for deployment.
Let's start with hiring new employees. Try pressing the Hire button.

Here you can see the information and looks of your soon to be new employee. You can increase one of the four state values before hiring them by clicking the arrow button next to it. If for example you wish to hire an employee that has more HP, you can increase its Fortitude. Please try doing this.

As you increase the state values of an employee before hiring, the amount of LOB required to hire them will increase as well. The higher the values, the more LOB it will cost. You may need to review how much LOB you are willing to spend on one employee as well as how much you have left after ward before finalizing your decisions.
Once you finish setting the employee the way you want it, you can press the Hire button again to hire the employee. Please do so now.
You now have hired a new employee. Let's take a look at it's status and information. Please click on the employee.

Just like during management, the information displayed about the employee here is the same. If you think your employee could use an increase in a state value, you can still do so by reinforcing the employee. Please press on the Reinforcement of Employee button.

And just like when hiring a new employee, you can increase a state value here by pressing the arrow next to it. Like before it will cost LOB when you do this, so keep that in mind. Try increasing the prudence by 1.
Now, to finish the reinforcement, press confirm.
Your new employee seems ready to be dispatched. Let's try to do this. Click and drag the employee with the primary mouse button over to one of the slots in the Central Command Team.

Well done. Now lets give to it some equipment. Remember that we extracted some E.G.O Equipment from the abnormality the previous day? We can give those to the employees. Please press the E.G.O List button.

Currently displayed in the center is the list of available E.G.O Weapons you collected and some information about them. Now click on one of the employees you have which shown in the list on the right to select it.
Good. You can now equip E.G.O Weapon to the selected employee by pressing one of the empty slots under Equippability.
Now let's look at the list of E.G.O Suits we have available. Please press on the E.G.O Suit tab.
Like before, you can equip one of the available E.G.O Suits by pressing one of the empty slots.
Please try equipping the other employees with both an E.G.O Weapon and E.G.O Suit.
Excellent. Now lets head back to the deployment screen. Please press Leave.
Looks like there is a Mission here that you can clear on this day. You don't nessecarily have to clear it, but it is recommended since it would allow you to conduct research the next day.

One more thing. If you have any questions before starting the management process again, you can review the manual by hitting the button on top. You can also view the manual from the menu displayed when pressing ESC.
Next I will tell you briefly how to deal with emergiency situations that can occur during management. When you're ready for that, please press the Start button.

Let me explain to you how to deal with emergiency situations. The number displayed here is called a Qliphoth Counter. It will decrease when you do something that violates the guidelines displayed at Managerial Works on the abnormality's information screen or fail to avert the Qliphoth Meltdown in time.
Are you wondering now what would happen when the Qliphoth Counter of an abnormality hits 0? Let's find out. Please select the containment unit and order an employee to do Repression work.

When an abnormality's Qliphoth Counter hits 0, the abnormality will either escape or use a special ability. This can lead to inconvenient situations. This particular abnormality happens to escape under this condition. Employees can't work with it when it is escaped, so we'll need to Suppress it. Please select the escaped abnormality.

Abnormalities have four different types of damage they can inflict on employees. RED which decreases Health (HP), WHITE which decreases Sanity (SP), BLACK which decreases both HP and SP and PALE, which decreases Health by percentages based on the target's maximum HP. Employees equipped with E.G.O Weapons can also utilize one of these 4 damage types.

Abnormalities also have a set of defenses based on the damage types. Some type of damage might be weaker while others may be fatal to them. You can suppress an abnormality more effectively when your employees attack using the type of damage the abnormality is weak against.

This abnormality deals RED damage and is weak to WHITE damage. Conveniently, our employees are all equipped with E.G.O Suits that offer resistance against RED damage and carry E.G.O Weapons that deal WHITE damage.

One more thing, if the employee carries a E.G.O Weapon which E.G.O Level is higher than the abnormality's Risk Level, they will deal more damage to the abnormality and take less damage from it. In the current situation, the E.G.O Level and Abnormality's Risk Level are the same, so currently this does not apply.

When the suppression window is displayed, you can see what type of damage an employee will deal on the target before sending an order and when you hover your mouse over the employee, you will be able to see their defenses against the four types of damage abnormalities can inflict. Now please, choose an employee to conduct the suppression of this escaped abnormality.

Meeting an abnormality, especially when it is on the loose can be quite shocking and frightening for your employees. Just like when they enter a containment unit to do work on an abnormality, it could damage their Sanity. If the Risk Level of the abnormality is High compared to the employee's Level, it will cause a greater stain on their mind and lower their SP.

It looks like this abnormality might be a bit too strong to suppress for just one employee. Be careful by the way, if an employee dies, the E.G.O Equipment they were using will be lost as well. Let's order the rest of the employees to help suppress this abnormality. Please select the other two employees by clicking and dragging with the primary mouse button.

Now click on the abnormality with the secondary mouse button to immediately order them to suppress it. It's a lot safer and easier to give orders such as these when you Pauze. You can Pauze by pressing the icon in the lower left, or by pressing the Space Bar on your keyboard.
You did well handling this situation. Now let’s move these employees to the main room in the department. Select them all by clicking and dragging with the primary mouse button.
While they’re selected click the main room with secondary mouse button. You can use this method to move them to other places as well by the way, such as hallways and other departments.

When an employee has lost all of their sanity points (SP) they will panic. A panicked employee will show different behavior from a regular one and cannot be controlled. What they will do depends on their highest level state value. If you wish to learn more about this please refer to the <Employee Panic> article in the manual. Please click the panicked employee with primary mouse button.

Employees can be recovered from their panic when their SP is restored to 100%. You can restore their SP by attacking the employee with WHITE or BLACK damage dealing weapons. Conveniently, all the available employees are equipped with weapons that deal WHITE damage. Please select all available employees and order them to suppress the panicked employees.

That was excellent. Well done. If you ever get into a situation you'd wish to redo, such as reversing the damage that was done, you can do so by pressing ESC and click Return to Memory Repository or by clicking on Retry. When you choose Return to Memory Repository, you can go back to the last day the Memory was Imprinted into the Repository. When you do so, acquired E.G.O Equipment and abnormality observation details will remain with you. Retry doesn’t do that, but it does let you start from the current day’s deployment process.

Now let's call all employees back to the main room of the department. You can do this by selecting all of them and using secondary click on the desired location, but when you just want them all back in the main room, there is an easier way. Next to the regenerator guage there is a Return button. You can use this button to call back the employees assigned to the department to the respective main room. Please try doing so.

This wraps up our basic manager education and training sessions. If you have any questions during the management process, please refer to the manual by pressing F1. If you want to know what certain aspects of the user interface mean, hover your mouse over them and take a look at the tool tip displayed. Manager, I wish you luck and good health on the job.
